title: How 18 Minutes Changed History: Texas, Mexico, and the U.S. Takeover
description: A dramatic eighteen-minute battle at San Jacinto in 1836 changed the course of North American history, leading to Texas' independence from Mexico. Rooted in land disputes, cultural clashes, and slavery tensions, the Texas Revolution reshaped borders and power dynamics. The brief yet decisive victory by Texian forces marked the rise of the Republic of Texas. Within a decade, it was annexed by the U.S., igniting the Mexican-American War.
